Posts.Content: 2superboyz wrote: Hi! Thank you for taking time to read this. I saw my OB/GYN today because I found a swollen area (upper outer quadrant) on my left breast. I am 39 years old. No family history. I am a little concerned because she saw exactly what I was referring to, but upon examing my breast couldn't say exactly "what" was swollen. She said she felt something below the suspect area...she said maybe a cyst. While keeping her fingers on my breast she then told me to sit up. I sat up and she said, "No, that's not the same spot that's swollen." She said, "You know maybe that's your ligament." Then she said, "Or actually, that might be a lymph node." However, she said she wasn't concerned but would go on and order the mammogram and ultrasound. I'm more confused now than I was before I went in. Do lymph nodes just "swell" in your breast for minor reasons. She said, "You know, it's like when you might have a hangnail on your toe, but your lymph node in your neck will swell!" A swollen lymph node in a breast seems like a bigger deal than just something like a " hangnail!" Will lymph nodes swell with cysts? Any thoughts? Thanks so much! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Questions regarding doc visit 2superboyz
